DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to track post-discharge outcomes on prematurely born infants who are discharged from the NICU with a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Investigators plan to report on the spontaneous closure rate as well as the incidence of pulmonary and/or cardiac events in these infants. The goal is to identify risk factors associated with adverse outcomes in prematurely born infants who are sent home with a PDA.
DOC.criteria: Documentation of informed consent and authorization for participation. Estimated gestational age of 32 weeks or less. Active diagnosis of a PDA at discharge. At least one echocardiogram obtained during hospital stay documenting/ confirming PDA diagnosis. Parental agreement to provide followup information on their child. Cardiologist and/or Pediatrician willing to provide followup information on enrolled infants. No known major congenital anomalies (inborn error of metabolism, cyanotic congenital heart disease, gastroschisis, omphalocele, diaphragmatic hernia or other major gastrointestinal anomalies, major neurological injury or anomaly, multiple congenital anomalies). Chromosomal / genetic disorders Inherited metabolic disorders (Aa, fat or carbohydrate), Trisomies, Turner's syndrome,Vater's syndrome, CHARGE, DiGeorge or other 22q11 deletions, Major chromosomal duplications, deletions detectable on high resolution karyotype (not microarray). Parent(s) unwilling to participate in followup.
